intro: Rhyncholacis linearis, commonly known as the slender lacis, is a rare and delicate plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, linear leaves that give it a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
